name: Definitions
description:
This lesson with the "Meaning and Definitions" chapter of Harry J.Gensler's Introduction to Logic (Routledge Press).
Assume that these definitions try to explain current usage and don't stipulate how a term will be used.

SOMEONE PLEASE UPDATE THIS DESC

name: Syllogistic Translations
description:
Syllogistic logic studies arguments whose validity depends on "all," "no," "some," and similar notions.
This lesson is about translating sentences into syllogistic logic. It goes with the "Syllogistic Logic" chapter of Harry J. Gensler's Introduction to Logic (Routledge Press).

name: Syllogistic Arguments - How to Star
description: Syllogistic Arguments - How to star will test you knowledge of the star test.

name: Syllogistic Arguments - Symbolic
description: Syllogistic Arguments - Symbolic will test you knowledge of the star test to tell if an argument is valid.

name: Syllogistic Arguments - English
description: Syllogistic Arguments - Eymbolic will test you knowledge of the star test to tell if an argument is valid.

name: Truth Evaluations
description: Truth Evaluations will test you knowledge of true/false logic.

name: Unknown Evaluations
description: Unknown Evaluations will test you knowledge of true/false logic.

name: Syllogistic Arguments - Find Conclusion
description: Syllogistic Arguments - Find Conclusion will test if you can find the conclusion in a syllogistic argument.

name: Truth Tables
description: Truth Tables will test you knowledge of true/false logic.

name: Propositional Arguments - Find Conclusion
description: Propositional Arguments - Find Conclusion will test if you can find the conclusion in a propositional argument.
